00001 /**********************************************************doxygen*//** @file
00002  *  @brief   Constrained bottleneck spanning tree bound implemenation.
00003  *
00004  *  Implemenation of the Constrained bottleneck spanning tree (CBST) bound
00005  *  used as a lower bound for the symmetric constrained bottleneck TSP 
00006  *  objective value.
00007  *
00008  *  @author  John LaRusic
00009  *  @ingroup lib
00010  ****************************************************************************/
00011 #include "common.h"
00012 #include "lb.h"

00015  * Private function prototypes

00023 /**
00024  *  @brief  Solves a (slightly modified!) minimum spanning tree problem.
00025  *  @param  problem [in] problem structure
00026  *  @param  C [in] largest cost in problem
00027  *  @param  exclude_cost [in] excludes costs less than this value except...
00028  *  @param  cur_tree [in] includes any edge costs found in this tree
00029  *  @param  tree [out] the resulting minimum spanning tree
00030  *  @param  max_cost [out] the largest cost in the resulting tree
00031  *  @param  length [out] the total length of the resulting tree
00032  *  @param  heap [out] a temporary heap structure
00033  *  @param  in_heap [out] a temporary integer array
00034  *  @param  d [out] a temporary integer array
00035  */
00036 void
00037 min_span_tree(arrow_problem *problem, int C, int exclude_cost,
00038               int *cur_tree, int *tree, int *max_cost, double *length,
00039               arrow_heap *heap, int *in_heap, int *d);
00040 
00041 
00042 /****************************************************************************
00043  * Public function implementations
00044  ****************************************************************************/
00045 int
00046 arrow_cbst_solve(arrow_problem *problem, arrow_problem_info *info,
00047                  double max_length, arrow_bound_result *result)
00048 {
00049     int ret = ARROW_SUCCESS;
00050     int *tree, *cur_tree, *in_heap, *d;
00051     int max_cost;
00052     double length;
00053     arrow_heap heap;
00054     
00055     double start_time, end_time;
00056     start_time = arrow_util_zeit();
00057     
00058     /* Allocate data */
00059     if(!arrow_util_create_int_array(problem->size, &tree))
00060     {
00061         arrow_print_error("Could not initialize tree array.");
00062         ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00063         goto CLEANUP;
00064     }
00065     if(!init_data(problem->size, &heap, &cur_tree, &in_heap, &d))
00066     {
00067         arrow_print_error("Could not initialize MST data structures.");
00068         ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00069         goto CLEANUP;
00070     }
00071     
00072     /* Initial MST call to determine feasibility and bottleneck value */
00073     min_span_tree(problem, info->max_cost, INT_MIN, cur_tree, tree,
00074                   &max_cost, &length, &heap, in_heap, d);
00075     /* See if given max_length is feasible */
00076     if(length > max_length)
00077     {
00078         arrow_print_error("max_length infeasible; must be >= %.0f", length);
00079         ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00080         goto CLEANUP;
00081     }
00082 
00083     arrow_debug("\nSpanning tree length: %.0f\n", length);
00084 
00085     end_time = arrow_util_zeit();
00086     
00087     result->obj_value = max_cost;
00088     result->total_time = end_time - start_time;    
00089     
00090 CLEANUP:
00091     if(tree != NULL) free(tree);
00092     return ret;
00093 }
00094  
00095 int
00096 arrow_cbst_mst_solve(arrow_problem *problem, arrow_problem_info *info,
00097                      int *tree, int *max_cost, double *length)
00098 {
00099     arrow_heap heap;
00100     int  *cur_tree, *in_heap, *d;
00101     int ret = ARROW_SUCCESS;
00102     
00103     if(!init_data(problem->size, &heap, &cur_tree, &in_heap, &d))
00104     {
00105         arrow_print_error("Could not initialize MST data structures.");
00106         ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00107         goto CLEANUP;
00108     }
00109     
00110     min_span_tree(problem, info->max_cost, INT_MIN, cur_tree, tree,
00111                   max_cost, length, &heap, in_heap, d);
00112     
00113 CLEANUP:
00114     destroy_data(&heap, &cur_tree, &in_heap, &d);
00115     return ret;
00116 }
00117 
00118 
00119 /****************************************************************************
00120  * Private function implementations
00121  ****************************************************************************/
00122 void
00123 min_span_tree(arrow_problem *problem, int C, int exclude_cost,
00124               int *cur_tree, int *tree, int *max_cost, double *length,
00125               arrow_heap *heap, int *in_heap, int *d)
00126 {
00127     int i, j, cost, p, tree_size;
00128     
00129     /* Node 0 gets inserted into an empty heap with cost 0.  All other nodes
00130        get inserted in with a cost of C + 1 */
00131     arrow_heap_empty(heap);
00132     arrow_heap_insert(heap, 0, 0);
00133     for(i = 1; i < problem->size; i++)
00134         arrow_heap_insert(heap, C + 1, i);
00135     
00136     /* Iniitalize arrays */
00137     for(i = 0; i < problem->size; i++)
00138     {
00139         tree[i] = -1;
00140         in_heap[i] = 1;
00141         d[i] = C + 1;
00142     }
00143     
00144     *max_cost = INT_MIN;
00145     *length = 0.0;
00146     tree_size = 0;
00147     
00148     /* Main loop */
00149     while(tree_size < problem->size - 1)
00150     {
00151         /*
00152         arrow_debug("HEAP:\n");
00153         arrow_heap_print(heap);
00154         arrow_debug("\n");
00155         */
00156         i = arrow_heap_get_min(heap);
00157         arrow_heap_delete_min(heap);
00158         in_heap[i] = 0;
00159         
00160         p = tree[i];
00161         if(p >= 0)
00162         {
00163             /* Insert (p,i) into tree, update length and max_cost */
00164             tree_size++;
00165             cost = problem->get_cost(problem, p, i);
00166             *length += cost;
00167             if(cost > *max_cost) *max_cost = cost;
00168             //arrow_debug(" - Add (%d,%d) to tree with cost %d\n", p, i, cost);
00169         }
00170         
00171         /* Iterate through adjacent nodes that are still in the heap */
00172         //arrow_debug(" - Examine neighbours of %d:\n", i);
00173         for(j = 0; j < problem->size; j++)
00174         {
00175             if((i != j) && (in_heap[j]))
00176             {
00177                 cost = problem->get_cost(problem, i, j);
00178                 /* We want to consider only adjacent nodes we can visit more
00179                    cheaply, and are not excluded by being less than the exclude
00180                    cost and not in the current solution */
00181                 //arrow_debug("   - (%d,%d): cost: %d, d[%d] = %d, cur_tree[%d] = %d\n",
00182                 //            i, j, cost, j, d[j], j, cur_tree[j]);
00183                 if((d[j] > cost) && 
00184                    ((cost > exclude_cost) || (cur_tree[j] != i)))
00185                 {
00186                     d[j] = cost;
00187                     tree[j] = i;
00188                     //arrow_debug("     - update d[%d] = %d\n", j, cost);
00189                     arrow_heap_change_key(heap, cost, j);
00190                 }
00191             }
00192         }
00193     }
00194 }
00195 
00196 int
00197 init_data(int n, arrow_heap *heap, int **cur_tree, int **in_heap, int **d)
00198 {
00199     int i;
00200     
00201     if(!arrow_heap_init(heap, n))
00202         goto CLEANUP;
00203     if(!arrow_util_create_int_array(n, cur_tree))
00204         goto CLEANUP;
00205     if(!arrow_util_create_int_array(n, in_heap))
00206         goto CLEANUP;
00207     if(!arrow_util_create_int_array(n, d))
00208         goto CLEANUP;
00209         
00210     
00211     for(i = 0; i < n; i++)
00212     {
00213         (*cur_tree)[i] = 0;
00214         (*in_heap)[i] = 0;
00215         (*d)[i] = 0;
00216     }
00217     
00218     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00219 
00220 CLEANUP:
00221     destroy_data(heap, cur_tree, in_heap, d);
00222     return ARROW_FAILURE;
00223 }
00224 
00225 void
00226 destroy_data(arrow_heap *heap, int **cur_tree, int **in_heap, int **d)
00227 {
00228     arrow_heap_destruct(heap);
00229     if(*in_heap != NULL) free(*in_heap); *in_heap = NULL;
00230     if(*d != NULL) free(*d); *d = NULL;
00231     if(*cur_tree != NULL) free(*d); *cur_tree = NULL;
00232 }
